Notes.Mike's_Note: God delights to forgive and show steadfast love. It brings Him joy.
Notes.Bible_NASB: Who is a God like You, who pardons wrongdoing And passes over a rebellious act of the remnant of His possession? He does not retain His anger forever, Because He delights in mercy.

Notes.Mike's_Note: Spares the wicked to save the righteous
Notes.Bible_NASB: “Far be it from You to do such a thing, to kill the righteous with the wicked, so that the righteous and the wicked are treated alike. Far be it from You! Shall not the Judge of all the earth deal justly?” So the LORD said, “If I find in Sodom fifty righteous within the city, then I will spare the entire place on their account.”

Notes.Mike's_Note: God created man in a perfect world where man walked and communicated with God. What else could he possibly need? Yet, to use God's words, this situation was 'not good.' Man also needed human companionship.
Notes.Bible_VOICE: It is not good for the man to be alone, so I will create a companion for him, a perfectly suited partner.

Notes.Bible_NIV: They are darkened in their understanding and separated from the life of God because of the ignorance that is in them due to the hardening (pōrōsin, 4457) of their hearts (kardias, 2588).

Note_1.Mike's_Note: To become hardened is to close ourselves off from feeling and emotions; the feelings of ourselves as well as the feelings of others.
Note_1.source_Note: pōrōsin (4457) = a covering with a callous, blindness. "originally petrifaction, hardness and then the result of this, i.e. metaphorically applied to organs of feeling, meaning insensibility, numbness, obtuseness, dulling of the faculty of perception, deadness" (Souter).

Note_2.Mike's_Note: Our heart or core is the essence of who we are; the seat of our emotions and affections, as well as our thoughts
Note_2.source_Note: kardias (2588) = lit: the heart; mind, character, inner self, will, intention, center. Thayer's Greek Lexicon:  b. the center and seat of spiritual life, "the soul or mind, as it is the fountain and seat of the thoughts, passions, desires, appetites, affections, purposes, endeavors" (so in English heart, inner man, etc.)

Notes.Subtopic: Loss of feeling leads to sensuality
Notes.Note_1: apalgeó = loss of feeling of pain or grief.
Notes.Note_2: aselgeia = violent spite which rejects restraint and indulges in lawless insolence
Notes.Bible_NIV: Having lost all sensitivity (apalgeó), they have given themselves over to sensuality (aselgeia) so as to indulge in every kind of impurity, and they are full of greed.

Notes.Mike's_Note: sensual/natural G5591 psuchikos = natural, of the soul or mind. Such wisdom does not come down from above, but is earthly, unspiritual [soulish, worldly, focussed on physical senses], devilish.The context of this wisdom is jealousy and selfishness. Be careful not to over-emphasize and demonize human emotions in this verse.
It's not enough to know ABOUT God. He wants us to KNOW HIM.
We are created in the Image of God and in His likeness

Notes.Bible_NIV (copy): They must turn from evil and do good; they must seek peace and pursue it.
Notes.Mike's_Note: Psalm 34:14 - Seek peace (shalom) and pursue it. Part of shalom's meaning is "4. peace, quiet, tranquility, contentment" (Brown-Driver-Briggs Hebrew and English Lexicon, Unabridged, Electronic Database.)  1 Peter 3:11 - Seek peace (eiréné) and pursue it. Eiréné definition: one, peace, quietness, rest. Also "5. according to a conception distinctly peculiar to Christianity, "the tranquil state of a soul assured of its salvation through Christ, and so fearing nothing from God and content with its earthly lot, of whatsoerer sort that is" (THAYER'S GREEK LEXICON, Electronic Database.
